did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Brotherhood of Railroad Signalmen of America Photographs, 1949

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Brotherhood of Railroad Signalmen of America (BRSA)

did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: A collection of black and white photographs of members of the Brotherhood of Railroad Signalmen of America, both formal committee pictures, and one candid photograph.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Brotherhood of Railroad Signalmen [BRS] is a labor union in the United States. It was founded in 1901 and represents workers who are tasked with maintaining railroad signal systems, highway-rail crossing warning systems and fabricating railroad signal equipment. The BRS is affiliated with the AFL-CIO and is a member of the Transportation Trades Department.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: This collection consist of four black and white photographs. On is identified as the General Chairman's Meeting in Chicago, Illinois at the Morrison Hotel on September 24-25, 1949. The second, which has a Toledo, Ohio photographer's stamp on the back, is a picture of 13 unidentified men. The third photograph shows 11 unidentified men. At least one particular man appears in each of these photographs, but he is unidentified. The final picture is a candid shot of men and women at a formal dinner.

processinfo.head: PROCESSING INFORMATION:
processinfo.p: The photgraph in folder 2 is creased and requires delicate handling.
